page.title: 01Moorland above Skeabost
page.content: Predominantely peat moorland with a small part of forestry encoaching on the part. The Loch is fairly large and the source of the Riva Tora, used by nesting birds and the geese fly here for the night. Area used for rough grazing for the sheep. Also widely heather covered. No habitation, but extensively used by local inhabitants for cutting peats, which are dried and used for winter fuel. The visible track was made just for the carts to bring down the peats. Apart from the local crofters, we are probably the only people to visit this area from a leisure point of view. The walk to the top of Ben Roishader is very worthwhile.
